title: Can You Charge AirPods Without a Case? Tricks & Workarounds

steps.title: It's not possible to charge AirPods or AirPods Pro without the case.
steps.content: It's not possible to charge AirPods or AirPods Pro without the case. While many hacks on the web claim you can use certain chargers or apps to give your AirPods a charge, the only way to charge AirPods is to use an AirPods charging case. But don't worry—if your case is lost, damaged, or defective, you have options: Use a friend's charging case in the meantime. If you lost or damaged your AirPods charging case, you can use any charging case for the same model of AirPods to get anywhere from 4.5-6 hours of listening time (depending on your model) with a full charge . [1] X Research source Get an official Apple replacement case. The best way to get a replacement case is through Apple. The steps and pricing are a little different depending on whether the case is lost, damaged, or defective. Get a third-party replacement case. If you don't want to pay the full price for an Apple AirPods replacement case, you can purchase a more affordable case from an electronics retailer. It's very important that you buy a case that supports your exact model of AirPods, or else the case will not charge your AirPods. Apple doesn't recommend using third-party charging cases and can't guarantee their quality. Be sure to read customer reviews before buying a third-party charging case.

steps.title: "Forget" your old AirPods on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: "Forget" your old AirPods on your iPhone or iPad. Whether you're borrowing a charging case or got a replacement, you'll need to pair your AirPods with the case before you can use them. Start by "forgetting" your AirPods in your Bluetooth settings: [2] X Research source Open your iPhone or iPad's Settings . Tap Bluetooth . Tap the small "i" in a circle next to your AirPods. Tap Forget This Device . Tap Forget Device twice to confirm.

steps.title: Insert the AirPods into the new case.
steps.content: Insert the AirPods into the new case. Make sure you're using a case for the same model of AirPods. If the AirPods case does not have a charge, you'll want to charge it using a Lightning cable or Qi-certified charging mat for at least 15 minutes first. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open the lid of the charging case.
steps.content: Open the lid of the charging case. The status light on the case will flash amber.

steps.title: Press and hold the Setup button on the case.
steps.content: Press and hold the Setup button on the case. You can release your finger once the status light starts flashing white.

steps.title: Go to your iPhone or iPad's Home screen.
steps.content: Go to your iPhone or iPad's Home screen. You will see a message asking you to connect to your AirPods. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Connect.
steps.content: Tap Connect . Your iPhone or iPad will now pair with the new charging case. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . You can now use this case to charge your AirPods or AirPods Pro. [6] X Research source If you're borrowing the case from a friend, your friend will need to pair their own AirPods back to the case when you return the case. They can use the same steps in this method to do so. If you won't be able to recharge your AirPods for a while, you can conserve battery power by turning off noise cancellation and transparency modes.

steps.title: If you lost your charging case, you can buy a new one from Apple.
steps.content: If you lost your charging case, you can buy a new one from Apple. While there is a fee to replace a lost charging case, it's much cheaper than buying a new set of AirPods. To get a replacement charging case: [7] X Research source Locate your AirPods serial number first. You can find it on your iPhone or iPad—go to Settings > Bluetooth > your AirPods, tap the small "i" in a circle, and scroll down to "Serial Number." You can also find it on the original packaging for your case. [8] X Research source Go to https://getsupport.apple.com/products and select AirPods > Lost or Missing AirPods > Replace lost AirPods case . Alternatively, you can call Apple support at 1-800-275-2273 in the US, or visit https://support.apple.com/en-us/106932 to find the Apple support phone number for your region. Follow the on-screen instructions to process your payment for a replacement. If you called Apple by phone, a technician will assist you in processing your payment.

steps.title: Understand your replacement options.
steps.content: Understand your replacement options. If you've dropped, submerged, crushed, or otherwise damaged your AirPods charging case, you can get a replacement case from Apple. The replacement options vary depending on your level of Apple coverage: [9] X Research source If you purchased AppleCare+ for Headphones coverage and damage your charging case within your 2-year service term, Apple will replace the charging case for a small service fee. [10] X Research source If you don't have AppleCare+ for Headphones, you can still replace your case through Apple. You'll need to pay for the case, but it's a lot cheaper than buying a new set of AirPods.

steps.title: Get your replacement.
steps.content: Get your replacement. Creating a service request for your replacement AirPods case is easy: Locate your AirPods serial number first. You'll see it beneath the lid of your charging case. You can also find it on your iPhone or iPad—go to Settings > Bluetooth > your AirPods, tap the small "i" in a circle, and scroll down to "Serial Number." Visit https://getsupport.apple.com/products , select AirPods , choose Physical or Liquid Damage , and then select Replace damaged AirPods case . Follow the on-screen instructions to create your service request. You'll receive instructions for returning your AirPods and charging case to Apple at your local Apple service provider or through the mail. Apple will ship you a replacement immediately so you can continue enjoying your AirPods without much interruption. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Your AirPods are protected by Apple's Limited Warranty for one year from the original purchase date.
steps.content: Your AirPods are protected by Apple's Limited Warranty for one year from the original purchase date. [12] X Research source This warranty covers manufacturing defects and battery issues, but not accidental damage or normal wear and tear. If your charging case stopped charging your AirPods and there is no physical damage during this one-year term, Apple will replace the case for free. To replace a defective AirPods case: Get your AirPods serial number—you'll see it beneath the lid of your charging case. You can also find it on your iPhone or iPad—go to Settings > Bluetooth > your AirPods, tap the small "i" in a circle, and scroll down to "Serial Number." Call Apple support at 1-800-275-2273 in the US, or visit https://support.apple.com/en-us/106932 to find the Apple support phone number for your region. Alternatively, you can create a support request at https://getsupport.apple.com . Apple support will walk you through some basic troubleshooting steps, which may include cleaning your charging case —excess debris and buildup on the charging contacts could prevent your case from charging your AirPods. If the support team finds that your charging case is defective, they'll replace the case.

steps.title: Set up Notify When Left Behind.
steps.content: Set up Notify When Left Behind. If you have an iPhone 12 or later, you can use the Notify When Left Behind feature to alert you when you leave your AirPods Pro or AirPods (3rd Generation) at an unknown location. [13] X Research source To set up this feature: Open the Find My app on your iPhone or iPad. Tap Devices or Items . Tap your AirPods. Tap Notify When Left Behind and toggle on the switch.

steps.title: Use Find My iPhone.
steps.content: Use Find My iPhone. If you misplace both your AirPods and your case in the future, Find My iPhone will display their last known location on a map. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Attach a Bluetooth tracker to your AirPods case.
steps.content: Attach a Bluetooth tracker to your AirPods case. You can buy a special case for your AirPods case that contains a slot for an Apple AirTag or Tile tracker. Adding an AirTag, Tile, or other type of tracker to your case makes it easy to track down your missing AirPods case from your iPhone or iPad.
